utils.monitoring.initÂ¶

Source: src\utils\monitoring\__init__.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Real-time monitoring utilities for control systems.

This package provides tools for monitoring control loop performance, latency tracking, stability monitoring, and real-time constraint verification.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

 1#======================================================================================\\\
 2#========================== src/utils/monitoring/__init__.py ==========================\\\
 3#======================================================================================\\\
 4
 5"""
 6Real-time monitoring utilities for control systems.
 7
 8This package provides tools for monitoring control loop performance,
 9latency tracking, stability monitoring, and real-time constraint verification.
10"""
11
12from .latency import LatencyMonitor
13from .stability import (
14    LyapunovDecreaseMonitor,
15    SaturationMonitor,
16    DynamicsConditioningMonitor,
17    StabilityMonitoringSystem
18)
19from .diagnostics import (
20    DiagnosticChecklist,
21    InstabilityType,
22    DiagnosticResult
23)
24
25__all__ = [
26    "LatencyMonitor",
27    "LyapunovDecreaseMonitor",
28    "SaturationMonitor",
29    "DynamicsConditioningMonitor",
30    "StabilityMonitoringSystem",
31    "DiagnosticChecklist",
32    "InstabilityType",
33    "DiagnosticResult"
34]

DependenciesÂ¶

This module imports:

  • from .latency import LatencyMonitor

  • from .stability import LyapunovDecreaseMonitor, SaturationMonitor, DynamicsConditioningMonitor, StabilityMonitoringSystem

  • from .diagnostics import DiagnosticChecklist, InstabilityType, DiagnosticResult

Advanced Mathematical TheoryÂ¶

Real-Time Monitoring InfrastructureÂ¶

The monitoring subsystem provides comprehensive real-time tracking for control loop performance, stability, and resource utilization.

Monitoring HierarchyÂ¶

\[\begin{split} \text{Monitor} = \begin{cases} \text{Latency} & \text{(Execution time, deadlines)} \\ \text{Stability} & \text{(Lyapunov, saturation, conditioning)} \\ \text{Diagnostics} & \text{(Instability detection)} \\ \text{Memory} & \text{(Resource tracking)} \end{cases} \end{split}\]

Performance MetricsÂ¶

Execution time: $\( t_{\text{exec}} = t_{\text{end}} - t_{\text{start}} \)$

Deadline monitoring: $\( \text{Violation} = \mathbb{1}\{t_{\text{exec}} > t_{\text{deadline}}\} \)$

Statistical latency: $\( \begin{aligned} \mu &= \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N t_i \\ \sigma^2 &= \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N (t_i - \mu)^2 \\ p_{95} &= \inf\{x : F(x) \geq 0.95\} \end{aligned} \)$

Monitoring IntegrationÂ¶

The monitoring system integrates with:

  • Simulation loops: Real-time performance tracking

  • Controllers: Stability and saturation monitoring

  • Optimization: Convergence and numerical stability

  • Safety systems: Constraint violation detection

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

```{mermaid} graph TD A[Monitoring Package] â€“> B[Latency Monitor] A â€“> C[Stability Monitor] A â€“> D[Diagnostics] A â€“> E[Memory Monitor]

B --> F[Execution Timing]
B --> G[Deadline Checking]
B --> H[Statistics]

C --> I[Lyapunov Decrease]
C --> J[Saturation Detection]
C --> K[Conditioning Analysis]

D --> L[Instability Type]
D --> M[Diagnostic Checklist]
D --> N[Remediation]

E --> O[Memory Allocation]
E --> P[Usage Tracking]
E --> Q[Leak Detection]

style A fill:#e1f5ff
style C fill:#fff4e1
style D fill:#ffebee

```

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Basic Latency MonitoringÂ¶

```python from src.utils.monitoring import LatencyMonitor

Create latency monitorÂ¶

monitor = LatencyMonitor(dt=0.01) # 100 Hz control loop

Monitor control loopÂ¶

for k in range(1000): start = monitor.start()

# Control computation
u = controller.compute_control(x, state_vars, history)
x = integrator.integrate(dynamics, x, u, t)

# Check deadline
missed = monitor.end(start)
if missed:
    print(f"Deadline violation at step {k}")

t += 0.01

Get statisticsÂ¶

print(fâ€Mean latency: {monitor.mean_latency:.6f}sâ€) print(fâ€95th percentile: {monitor.p95_latency:.6f}sâ€) ```

Example 2: Integrated Stability MonitoringÂ¶

```python from src.utils.monitoring import ( LyapunovDecreaseMonitor, SaturationMonitor )

Create stability monitorsÂ¶

lyapunov_monitor = LyapunovDecreaseMonitor() saturation_monitor = SaturationMonitor(max_force=100.0)

Simulation with stability monitoringÂ¶

for k in range(1000): u = controller.compute_control(x, state_vars, history)

# Check saturation
saturation_ratio = saturation_monitor.check(u)
if saturation_ratio > 0.9:
    print(f"High saturation: {saturation_ratio:.2%}")

# Check Lyapunov decrease
is_stable = lyapunov_monitor.check_decrease(x, V_function)
if not is_stable:
    print(f"Lyapunov increase detected at step {k}")

x = integrator.integrate(dynamics, x, u, t)
t += 0.01

```

Example 3: Diagnostic AnalysisÂ¶

```python from src.utils.monitoring import DiagnosticChecklist

Create diagnostic checklistÂ¶

diagnostics = DiagnosticChecklist()

Run diagnostics after instabilityÂ¶

if not stable: results = diagnostics.run( state=x, control=u, controller=controller, dynamics=dynamics )

print(f"Instability type: {results.instability_type}")
print(f"Likely causes: {results.likely_causes}")
print(f"Recommended actions: {results.remediation}")

```

Example 4: Memory Leak DetectionÂ¶

```python from src.utils.monitoring import MemoryMonitor

Create memory monitorÂ¶

memory_monitor = MemoryMonitor(threshold_mb=500)

Monitor long-running simulationÂ¶

for trial in range(1000): result = run_simulation(trial)

# Check memory usage
memory_mb = memory_monitor.check()
if memory_mb > 450:
    print(f"High memory usage: {memory_mb:.1f} MB")

# Periodic cleanup
if trial % 100 == 99:
    memory_monitor.force_gc()

```

Example 5: Comprehensive Monitoring PipelineÂ¶

```python from src.utils.monitoring import StabilityMonitoringSystem

Create integrated monitoring systemÂ¶

monitoring = StabilityMonitoringSystem( dt=0.01, enable_latency=True, enable_stability=True, enable_diagnostics=True, enable_memory=True )

Run monitored simulationÂ¶

result = monitoring.run_monitored_simulation( controller=controller, dynamics=dynamics, x_initial=x_initial, duration=10.0 )

Get comprehensive reportÂ¶

report = monitoring.generate_report() print(fâ€Performance: {report[â€˜performanceâ€™]}â€) print(fâ€Stability: {report[â€˜stabilityâ€™]}â€) print(fâ€Diagnostics: {report[â€˜diagnosticsâ€™]}â€) print(fâ€Memory: {report[â€˜memoryâ€™]}â€) ```

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

```{mermaid} graph TD A[Component] â€“> B[Subcomponent 1] A â€“> C[Subcomponent 2] B â€“> D[Output] C â€“> D

style A fill:#e1f5ff
style D fill:#e8f5e9

```

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Basic UsageÂ¶

```python from src.utils.monitoring import Component

component = Component() result = component.process(data) ```

Example 2: Advanced ConfigurationÂ¶

```python component = Component( option1=value1, option2=value2 ) ```

Example 3: Integration with SimulationÂ¶

```python

Integration exampleÂ¶

for k in range(num_steps): result = component.process(x) x = update(x, result) ```

Example 4: Performance OptimizationÂ¶

```python component = Component(enable_caching=True) ```

Example 5: Error HandlingÂ¶

```python try: result = component.process(data) except ComponentError as e: print(fâ€Error: {e}â€) ```
